snippet.title: The Real Examples of "Life isn't fair"
snippet.description:
Johnny depp and amber heard case.

ohnny lost a reputation he worked for years to build. No one wanted to hire him, or even work with him. He was tainted by the label abuser.

He received hate, from once-fans, from the media, from basically everyone.

And, of course, it was justified. He hurt an innocent, defenseless woman. We should hate him. Right?

Tell the world I, Johnny Depp, a man, I’m a victim too of domestic violence

And see how many people believe or side with you.

But this year, Johnny released tapes that reframed the allegations we were all so quick to believe.

Maybe they weren’t so golden after all.

She admitted to hitting him and throwing cans and glass bottles at him. She says that glass from one such assault sliced the top of Depp’s finger off.

And then she mocked him. Because she knew no one would believe his word over hers.

You think life is fair?

This is a man who was physically assaulted by his wife and then torn down on global television because we all love a villain.

We all love a villain, even when they’ve done nothing wrong.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

My wife was killed on the way home from work, August 31st 2020, Colorado Springs Colorado on Highway 94. She was just trying to get home. State patrol says that they think she reacted to a deer or someone in her Lane( no Witnesses) . She swerved to miss them and lost control of the vehicle and went into the westbound Lane and was T-boned and and crushed to death almost instantly. She was a school teacher for a local school district. She taught second grade. The kindest person you could ever meet. She was 36 never lied, cheated, stole. The kindest most moral person you could meet, an Earth Angel. Did all the right things in life had a master's degree, good career. We are planning to have a baby that year. She was robbed of everything in seconds and so I now I come home to an empty house. My best friend is gone, my soulmate, the love of my life, my everything is gone. We have been married for 15 years, all gone. How fair is that, that's our story of how unfair life can suddenly be. There are no guarantee tomorrow's as we all know. Cherish what you have it can be taken from you in seconds. Next time you get into your vehicle take a good look at your home, it might be the last time you ever see it. You never know, car accidents are all far too common these days. 😔
tags: The breakdown of a golden couple.
